definition: breastfeeding
to feed
mother/elderly female relative/origin/source/(of animals) female
breast/milk

sentences.english: A mother who smokes can also pass nicotine to her baby through her breast milk.
sentences.chinese: 吸菸的母親還有可能通過餵母乳把尼古丁傳給嬰兒。

sentences.english: The young mother fed her baby girl with milk.
sentences.chinese: 她年輕的母親餵母乳的女嬰。

sentences.english: Breast -feeding is considered better than bottle-feeding in general.
sentences.chinese: 一般來說，餵母乳比喂牛奶好。

sentences.english: You should breast-feed , or else your milk will be less and less.
sentences.chinese: 你應該先餵母乳，否則你的奶會越來越少的。

sentences.english: In addition, when heard that breast-feeding can not eat pepper, is it?
sentences.chinese: 另外，聽說餵母乳時不能喫花椒，是嗎？

sentences.english: Smoking mothers can also pass the nicotine to the infant through breast milk.
sentences.chinese: 吸菸的母親還有可能通過餵母乳把尼古丁傳給嬰兒。

sentences.english: Breastfeeding must be the most fundamental human act of nurturing;
sentences.chinese: 餵母乳是人類最基本的餵養行爲。

definition: midwife
breastfeeding
yellow face, emaciated body (idiom); malnourished and sickly in appearance
adopted daughter (traditional adoption, i.e. without legal ramifications)
lit. a girl changes eighteen times between childhood and womanhood (idiom)/fig. a young woman is very different from the little girl she once was
to follow sb closely (idiom)/to keep close to
precious darling (often refers to one's child)/sweetheart
loss of love/breakup of a relationship
contraction of the uterus (during childbirth)
listless/dispirited/washed out/also written 沒精打彩|没精打彩
adopted son (traditional adoption, i.e. without legal ramifications)
to like looking attractive (usually of girls)/aestheticism
withdrawal (from drugs)
to feel sick/to feel nauseous/to feel disgusted
to be pregnant (idiom)
variant of 慪氣|怄气[ou4 qi4]
